items.title: Dolphins’ James Daniels, Storm Duck to miss time with injuries
items.summary: MIAMI GARDENS — Two Miami Dolphins starters who were injured in Sunday’s loss to the Indianapolis Colts, right guard James Daniels and cornerback Storm Duck, will miss additional time with their respective injuries. Daniels hurt his right pectoral muscle on the Dolphins’ third offensive play at Lucas Oil Stadium and did not return. “It’s not season-ending,” Dolphins coach Mike McDaniel said ...

items.title: Colts beat Dolphins for first season-opening win since 2013
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — The Colts honored late owner Jim Irsay the best way they could — with a win. They dominated the Miami Dolphins, 33-8, in the season-opener Sunday afternoon at Lucas Oil Stadium. The win is their first in week 1 since quarterback Andrew Luck led them to victory against the Oakland Raiders in 2013. [...]

items.title: Colts Blue Zone Podcast 422: Streak Busters! Colts Top Dolphins in Season Opener
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts put together a complete performance in Week 1 to snap their streak of futility in season openers. Standout performances from Daniel Jones, Tyler Warren and multiple defenders highlighted the 33-8 win. In this episode of the Colts Blue Zone Podcast, we look back at the game and how the team honored late [...]

items.title: Colts honor late owner with 'win for Jim' mantra, Ring of Honor induction
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — Leading up to Week 1, the message around Horseshoe Headquarters was simple — win for Jim. The Colts did exactly that on Sunday afternoon with a dominant victory over the Miami Dolphins. With the roof and window open at Lucas Oil Stadium, the Colts snapped a 12-year winless streak of season-openers, and everyone felt [...]

items.title: Colts' defense makes statement in Week 1 win over Dolphins: 'New big dogs in town'
items.summary: The Colts had three sacks and two interceptions in their 33-8 win over the Dolphins on Sunday.

items.title: 'Win For Jim' mantra inspires Colts in Week 1 win: 'We're playing for a bigger purpose'
items.summary: The Colts honored late Owner and CEO Jim Irsay not just by inducting him into their Ring of Honor on Sunday, but by thumping the Miami Dolphins, 33-8, to begin the 2025 season.

items.title: How Daniel Jones, Shane Steichen and the Colts' offense threw a near-perfect game in Week 1 blowout win over Dolphins
items.summary: The Colts became the first team since 1977 to score on all seven of their possessions in their 33-8 trouncing of the Miami Dolphins on Sunday at Lucas Oil Stadium.

items.title: Sideline to Sideline: Jim Irsay Memories
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS - Every week Blue Zone's Chris Widlic goes sideline to sideline with the Colts trying to give fans more insight to their favorite players. With Jim Irsay going into the franchise's Ring of Honor today, Chris asks players what their favorite memory is of the team's late owner.

items.title: Keys to the Game: Colts vs. Dophins
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS - The Colts are looking for their first win in week one of the NFL season since Andrew Luck led the team to victory over the Oakland Raiders in 2013. IndyStar Colts insider Joel A. Erickson gives his keys to snapping that skid in today's season opener against the Miami Dolphins.

items.title: Where to Watch: Dolphins at Colts for 2025 season opener

Indianapolis will be looking to snap that embarrassingly long franchise streak, and perhaps they’ll get some help from up […]
